013package org.apache.juneau.bean.openapi3;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConverterUtils.*;
018
019import java.net.*;
020import java.util.*;
021
022import org.apache.juneau.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
025
026/**
027 * A single encoding definition applied to a single schema property.
028 *
029 * <p>
030 * The Encoding Object is a single encoding definition applied to a single schema property. It allows you to define 
031 * how a property should be serialized when it's part of a request or response body with a specific media type.
032 *
033 * <h5 class='section'>OpenAPI Specification:</h5>
034 * <p>
035 * The Encoding Object is composed of the following fields:
036 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
037 *    <li><c>contentType</c> (string) - The Content-Type for encoding a specific property. Default value depends on the property type
038 *    <li><c>headers</c> (map of {@link HeaderInfo}) - A map allowing additional information to be provided as headers
039 *    <li><c>style</c> (string) - Describes how a specific property value will be serialized depending on its type
040 *    <li><c>explode</c> (boolean) - When this is true, property values of type array or object generate separate parameters for each value
041 *    <li><c>allowReserved</c> (boolean) - Determines whether the parameter value should allow reserved characters
042 * </ul>
043 *
044 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
045 * <p class='bcode'>
046 *    <jc>// Construct using SwaggerBuilder.</jc>
047 *    Encoding <jv>x</jv> = <jsm>encoding</jsm>()
048 *       .setContentType(<js>"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"</js>)
049 *       .setStyle(<js>"form"</js>)
050 *       .setExplode(<jk>true</jk>);
051 *
052 *    <jc>// Serialize using JsonSerializer.</jc>
053 *    String <jv>json</jv> = Json.<jsm>from</jsm>(<jv>x</jv>);
054 *
055 *    <jc>// Or just use toString() which does the same as above.</jc>
056 *    <jv>json</jv> = <jv>x</jv>.toString();
057 * </p>
058 * <p class='bcode'>
059 *    <jc>// Output</jc>
060 *    {
061 *       <js>"contentType"</js>: <js>"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"</js>,
062 *       <js>"style"</js>: <js>"form"</js>,
063 *       <js>"explode"</js>: <jk>true</jk>
064 *    }
065 * </p>
066 *
067 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
068 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.0.0#encoding-object">OpenAPI Specification &gt; Encoding Object</a>
069 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/docs/specification/describing-request-body/">OpenAPI Describing Request Body</a>
070 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauBeanOpenApi3">juneau-bean-openapi-v3</a>
071 * </ul>
072 */
073public class Encoding extends OpenApiElement{
074
075   private String contentType,
076         style;
077   private Map<String,HeaderInfo> headers;
078   private Boolean explode,
079         allowReserved;
080
081   /**
082    * Default constructor.
083    */
084   public Encoding() { }
085
086   /**
087    * Copy constructor.
088    *
089    * @param copyFrom The object to copy.
090    */
091   public Encoding(Encoding copyFrom) {
092      super(copyFrom);
093
094      this.contentType = copyFrom.contentType;
095      this.style = copyFrom.style;
096      this.explode = copyFrom.explode;
097      this.allowReserved = copyFrom.allowReserved;
098      this.headers = copyOf(copyFrom.headers, HeaderInfo::copy);
099   }
100
101   /**
102    * Make a deep copy of this object.
103    *
104    * @return A deep copy of this object.
105    */
106   public Encoding copy() {
107      return new Encoding(this);
108   }
109
110   @Override /* Overridden from OpenApiElement */
111   protected Encoding strict() {
112      super.strict();
113      return this;
114   }
115
116   @Override /* Overridden from OpenApiElement */
117   public Encoding strict(Object value) {
118      super.strict(value);
119      return this;
120   }
121
122   /**
123    * Bean property getter:  <property>contentType</property>.
124    *
125    * <p>
126    * The URL pointing to the contact information.
127    *
128    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
129    */
130   public String getContentType() {
131      return contentType;
132   }
133
134   /**
135    * Bean property setter:  <property>url</property>.
136    *
137    * <p>
138    * The value can be of any of the following types: {@link URI}, {@link URL}, {@link String}.
139    * <br>Strings must be valid URIs.
140    *
141    * <p>
142    * URIs defined by {@link UriResolver} can be used for values.
143    *
144    * @param value
145    *    The new value for this property.
146    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
147    * @return This object
148    */
149   public Encoding setContentType(String value) {
150      contentType = value;
151      return this;
152   }
153
154   /**
155    * Bean property getter:  <property>style</property>.
156    *
157    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
158    */
159   public String getStyle() {
160      return style;
161   }
162
163   /**
164    * Bean property setter:  <property>description</property>.
165    *
166    * @param value
167    *    The new value for this property.
168    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
169    * @return This object
170    */
171   public Encoding setStyle(String value) {
172      style = value;
173      return this;
174   }
175
176   /**
177    * Bean property getter:  <property>variables</property>.
178    *
179    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
180    */
181   public Map<String, HeaderInfo> getHeaders() {
182      return headers;
183   }
184
185   /**
186    * Bean property setter:  <property>variables</property>.
187    *
188    * @param value
189    *    The new value for this property.
190    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
191    * @return This object
192    */
193   public Encoding setHeaders(Map<String, HeaderInfo> value) {
194      headers = copyOf(value);
195      return this;
196   }
197
198   /**
199    * Adds one or more values to the <property>headers</property> property.
200    *
201    * @param key The mapping key.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
202    * @param value
203    *    The values to add to this property.
204    *    <br>Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
205    * @return This object
206    */
207   public Encoding addHeader(String key, HeaderInfo value) {
208      assertArgNotNull("key", key);
209      assertArgNotNull("value", value);
210      headers = mapBuilder(headers).sparse().add(key, value).build();
211      return this;
212   }
213
214   /**
215    * Bean property getter:  <property>required</property>.
216    *
217    * <p>
218    * The type of the object.
219    *
220    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
221    */
222   public Boolean getExplode() {
223      return explode;
224   }
225
226   /**
227    * Bean property setter:  <property>explode</property>.
228    *
229    * <p>
230    * The type of the object.
231    *
232    * @param value
233    *    The new value for this property.
234    *    <br>Property value is required.
235    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
236    * @return This object
237    */
238   public Encoding setExplode(Boolean value) {
239      explode = value;
240      return this;
241   }
242
243   /**
244    * Bean property getter:  <property>required</property>.
245    *
246    * <p>
247    * The type of the object.
248    *
249    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
250    */
251   public Boolean getAllowReserved() {
252      return allowReserved;
253   }
254
255   /**
256    * Bean property setter:  <property>explode</property>.
257    *
258    * <p>
259    * The type of the object.
260    *
261    * @param value
262    *    The new value for this property.
263    *    <br>Property value is required.
264    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
265    * @return This object
266    */
267   public Encoding setAllowReserved(Boolean value) {
268      allowReserved = value;
269      return this;
270   }
271
272   @Override /* Overridden from OpenApiElement */
273   public <T> T get(String property, Class<T> type) {
274      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
275      return switch (property) {
276         case "contentType" -> toType(getContentType(), type);
277         case "style" -> toType(getStyle(), type);
278         case "headers" -> toType(getHeaders(), type);
279         case "explode" -> toType(getExplode(), type);
280         case "allowReserved" -> toType(getAllowReserved(), type);
281         default -> super.get(property, type);
282      };
283   }
284
285   @Override /* Overridden from OpenApiElement */
286   public Encoding set(String property, Object value) {
287      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
288      return switch (property) {
289         case "allowReserved" -> setAllowReserved(toBoolean(value));
290         case "contentType" -> setContentType(Utils.s(value));
291         case "explode" -> setExplode(toBoolean(value));
292         case "headers" -> setHeaders(mapBuilder(String.class, HeaderInfo.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
293         case "style" -> setStyle(Utils.s(value));
294         default -> {
295            super.set(property, value);
296            yield this;
297         }
298      };
299   }
300
301   @Override /* Overridden from OpenApiElement */
302   public Set<String> keySet() {
303      var s = setBuilder(String.class)
304         .addIf(allowReserved != null, "allowReserved")
305         .addIf(contentType != null, "contentType")
306         .addIf(explode != null, "explode")
307         .addIf(headers != null, "headers")
308         .addIf(style != null, "style")
309         .build();
310      return new MultiSet<>(s, super.keySet());
311   }
312}
